availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Rodolph Albert (Maysville, Mason Co, Ky, music teacher)

body.p: Maysville, Mason County, Kentucky, musician and music teacher. Berlin, Prussia native. Married to Katharine Smith Albert by a justice of the peace in Hamilton County, Ohio, on March 4, 1856. Married to Katharine Smith Albert by a minister in Mason County on August 6, 1856. Father of Anna Francesca Albert, Mary Albert, Florance Albert, and Sophia Albert. Tinner in Hamilton County, Ohio, in 1850. Music teacher in Maysville in 1860. Employed Julia Lang as a nurse in Maysville in 1860. Musician in Mason County in 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Ohio, Hamilton County, Cincinnati, Ward 9, p. 965A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Mason County, Maysville, p. 334.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Mason County, Maysville, Ward 5, p. 456B.
Marriage Records. Ohio Marriages. Hamilton County Courthouse, film no. 000344470, p. 2.
Kentucky Marriage Records on Microfilm (1852-1910), KDLA, Roll #994027-994058, Mason County Marriages, p. 11.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records (Provost Marshal General's Bureau; Consolidated Enrollment Lists, 1863-1865), NARA RG 110, Kentucky, 9th Congressional District, Vol. 3, October 1863, p. 2, p. 3 of microfilm, (Accessed via ancestry.com on May 22, 2020).
George Norbury Mackenzie and Nelson Osgood Rhoades, eds., Colonial Families of the United States of America, Vol. IV (1912, Reprinted, Baltimore: Genealogical Publishing Co., Inc., 1966), 229.
